means: 诱惑人的，具有非常的魅力的

sentence.Network_en: I came upon an irresistible item at a yard sale.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一次庭院拍卖会上，我偶然发现了一个忍不住想买的东西。

sentence.Network_en: Keegan's team have been cutting an irresistible swathe through the first division.
sentence.Network_cn: 基冈的球队在甲级赛中所向披靡。

sentence.Network_en: They feel the case for change is irresistible.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们认为求变的理由不容反驳。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin irresistibilis, from in- 'not' + resistibilis (from resistere 'resist')

entry.tran: 不可抵抗的;不可抗拒的;不能压制的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a desire or force as irresistible, you mean that it is so powerful that it makes you act in a certain way, and there is nothing you can do to prevent this.

example.ex: It proved an irresistible temptation to Hall to go back.
example.tran: 事实证明回去对霍尔是个不可抗拒的诱惑。
来自金融市场的不可抗拒的压力

entry.tran: 吸引人的;富有诱惑力的
entry.def: If you describe something or someone as irresistible, you mean that they are so good or attractive that you cannot stop yourself from liking them or wanting them.

example.tran: 音乐非常好听，令人难以抗拒。

sentences.sentence: "what happens when an irresistible force meets an immovable object?"

auth_sentence.content: Teenagers are raw and understandably irresistible to a photographer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Teenagers are raw and understandably irresistible to a photographer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Teenagers are raw and understandably irresistible to a photographer.

auth_sentence.content: His voice was irresistible; it was like necromancy.
auth_sentence.res_content: His voice was irresistible; it was like necromancy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His voice was irresistible; it was like necromancy.

auth_sentence.content: But his prominence this time makes the strategy irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content: But his prominence this time makes the strategy irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But his prominence this time makes the strategy irresistible.

stems_affixes.word_buile: ir不+resistible可抗拒的→adj.不可抗拒的
persist[v.坚持]+ent表形容词→adj.固执的,坚持的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抵抗的, 有抵抗力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: resist[v.反抗,抵抗]+ent表形容词→adj.抵抗的, 有抵抗力的
resist[v.反抗,抵抗]+ible可..的→adj.可抵抗的
assist[v.帮助]+ant人→n.助手,助教;辅助物
consist[v.[in]在于,存在于;[of]由…组成,由…构成]+ence表名词→n.坚固性,浓度

stems_affixes.value_cn: 存在,实在;生存,生活[方式]
stems_affixes.word_buile: exist[v.存在;生存;生活]+ence表名词→n.存在,实在;生存,生活[方式]
insist[v.[on]坚持要求,坚决主张,坚持]+ence表名词→n.坚持,强求
persist[v.坚持]+ence表名词→n.坚持, 持续
resist[v.反抗,抵抗]+ance表名词→n.[to]抵抗,反抗;抵抗力,阻力;电阻
resist[v.反抗,抵抗]+ence表名词→n.抵抗力

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生存, 生活, 留存
stems_affixes.word_buile: subsist[v.生存,存在,供养]+ence表名词→n.生存, 生活, 留存
as加强动作+sist站→站过来→帮助
con共同+sist站立→站到一起→帮助
de加强+sist站立→站着不动→停止
in加强+sist站立→坚定地站立
per始终+sist站→站到最后→坚持
re反+sist站→反着站→反抗
sub下面+sist站立→站下去,活下去

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"使……,成为,进入,再"; 2. 放在同辅音词根前表示"不,无"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不顾的, 不考虑的, 无关的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ir不,无+respective各自的→adj.不顾的, 不考虑的, 无关的
ir不,无+rational合理的→adj.不合理的
ir不,无+regular规则的→adj.不规则的
ir不,无+relative相关的→adj.无关的
ir不,无+reproachable能被指责的→adj.无可指责的
ir不,无+resistible可抗拒的→adj.不可抗拒的
ir不,无+resolute果断的→adj.无决断力的
ir不,无+refutable可反驳的→adj.无可反驳的
ir不,无+revocable可取消的→adj.不可取消的
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rupt断+ion表名词→打断[别人]→闯入
ir不+regularity整齐, 匀称→n.不规则,无规律
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rig水+ate表动词→进水→灌溉
ir使……,成为,进入,再+rit擦+ate表动词→进入磨擦→激怒
ir使……,成为,进入,再+radi光线+ate表动词→发光→生辉

means.word_mean: 无法抗拒的; 不可遏止的; 无法抵制的

sentences.en: Their arguments were irresistible;I had to agree.
sentences.cn: 他们的论据很有说服力, 我也不得不同意。
